title: ICE canola futures inch lower in rangebound trade
text:
ICE canola futures inch lower in rangebound trade

CALGARY, Alberta, Sept 25 (Reuters) - ICE (NYSE: ) Canada canola futures dipped on Wednesday, with trading muted as concerns about bad weather disrupting the harvest were outweighed by declines in soybeans that dragged canola lower:

* The benchmark November canola futures contract RSX9 closed 40 cents lower at $448.90 per tonne.

* took its lead from a fall in soybean prices, one industry source said, which offset concerns about weather forecasts calling for snow in the Canadian Prairies later this week. While snow is unlikely to damage crops it will slow an already-delayed harvest, he added.

* The November-January RSX9-F0 canola spread traded 3,777 times, closing at an $8.80 January premium, widening from $8.40 on Monday. The January-March spread RSF0-H0 traded 1,047 times.

* Chicago Board of Trade November soybeans SX9 settled 5 U.S. cents lower at US$8.89-1/4 a bushel, on concerns about U.S.-China trade relations becoming further strained. SOY/C

* The Canadian dollar edged lower against its U.S. counterpart. CAD/
description: ICE canola futures inch lower in rangebound trade
